alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Grady; Kingfisher; Noble; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 4:18AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected with a predominant type of sleet. Total combined sleet and snow accumulations of up to one inch, and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, southwest and western Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM Wednesday to 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Grady; Kingfisher; Noble; Washita
